An amazing breakfast in Barcelona's Boqueria!  Juanito's welcoming smile and charm made us feel immediately at home. We were very lucky to have gotten a seat right away.  Because we didn't speak Spanish or Catalan, Juanito asked us a few questions on what type of food we wanted (beef, shrimp, clam, fish, egg, etc).  We ordered coffee all around and anxiously waited to see what dishes were going to show up.  The first dish was a rich and hearty beef stew with potatoes and peas.  Served with a small loaf of bread to sop up the gravy.  The second dish was grilled prawns, lightly seasoned with sea salt and olive oil.  The prawns were smoky, sweet, and PERFECTLY cooked.  The third dish, was Bacala (salt cod) poached in garlic and olive oil!  All I can say is OMG! The fish was perfectly cooked, luscious and decadent. I especially loved how Juanito kept urging me to dip my bread into the garlic oil and gravy.  Our final dish, gently cooked egg "pie" with toasted bread (rubbed with tomato).  Such simple ingredients, yet what a big impact in terms of texture and flavor.  Prices and Pinotxo are very reasonable.  Our breakfast cost a mere 49 Euro.  What a deal for such spectacular food!  Thanks you Juanito and Pinotxo!  I will never forget your delicious food and warm hospitality.  I can't wait to visit you again!
